title: Quentin Jeannot 2016 La Fuissière Premier Cru  (Maranges)
description: Toasty aromas lead to a wine that has obviously had plenty of wood aging. That shows in this cooler vintage and dominates the red fruits. Of course, the fruit will fill out and there is plenty of weight there. It will be worth waiting at least until 2020 to drink.

title: Ramón Bilbao 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: A clover aromas leads on the nose, with white flower accents in the background. A round, healthy palate is mildly citric, with an orange note running strong. A steady finish helps this conclude well. Drink now.

title: Robert Oatley 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Margaret River)
description: Vigorous swirling and time in glass eventually eked out bramble fruit characters with florals, baking spices and vanilla oak notes. The palate is shy and tightly wound at the moment but everything is in balance. Drink 2019–2032.

title: Rough Day 2016 Chardonnay (Thracian Valley)
description: Aromas of white peach, white flowers and green apple prepare your palate for bright fruit flavors of ripe apple and yellow peach. This wine is well balanced, with a crisp and clean finish.

title: SalvaTerra 2014  Valpolicella Classico Superiore
description: This lovely wine has structure, finesse and character. It opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, cooking spice and underbrush while the elegantly structured palate boasts black cherry, white pepper and tobacco. It's balanced, with fresh acidity and supple tannins. Enjoy through 2022.

title: San Cassiano 2014  Valpolicella Superiore Ripasso
description: Aromas of black-skinned berry, baking spice and white pepper lead the nose while the smooth palate offers cassis, vanilla and sweet almond. It's ready and enjoyable, with supple tannins. Drink through 2022.

title: Sokol Blosser 2015 Dundee Hills Estate Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: This opens with black cherry fruit that carries a hint of dill. It's tart and somewhat thin, with an astringent finish marked by strawberry and citrus flavors.

title: Tedeschi 2013 La Fabriseria  (Valpolicella Classico Superiore)
description: Made with 35% Corvina, 30% Corvinone, 30% Rondinella and 10% Oseleta, this offers aromas suggesting black plum, raisin and tobacco. The soft, concentrated palate conveys ripe black cherry, cocoa and licorice. Rounded tannins provide polished support.

title: Villa Wolf 2016 Gewürztraminer (Pfalz)
description: Spring blossoms and pink grapefruit abound in this feather-light Gewürztraminer. Just a shade off dry, pristine tangerine and peach flavors are juicy and quaffable. It's a zesty, refreshingly spry wine to enjoy now through 2019.

title: Vincent Lumpp 2015 Clos du Cras Long Premier Cru  (Givry)
description: This small domaine in the Côte Chalonnais has produced a wine that is tough with tannins and with a dry core. There is some potential in the juicy acidity and spice that comes through the firm structure. It will need some time, so drink from 2020.
designation: Clos du Cras Long Premier Cru

title: Vincent Lumpp 2015 Clos Saint-Paul Premier Cru  (Givry)
description: This wine is still young but potentially rich and full of ripe fruits. Its tannins are balanced by the generous fruitiness, offering both structure and the chance for the wine to age. Drink this full, juicy wine from 2020.

title: Vincent Lumpp 2015 La Grande Berge Premier Cru  (Givry)
description: This white comes from vines in the southern limit of the appellation south of Beaune. It is ripe with citrus fruit and apples that are balanced by spice from wood aging. A zing of acidity gives it a crisp texture and a lively, perfumed aftertaste. Drink from 2019.

title: Webster Cellars 2013 Right Bank Red (Napa Valley)
description: A proprietary blend of 40% Merlot, 25% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Petit Verdot and 15% Cabernet Franc, this wine is juicy in cassis and red currant with a quiet embrace of toasted oak. Seamless in structure and tannin, it finishes with focus.

title: Yellow Tail 2016 Merlot (South Eastern Australia)
description: This is a dark fruited, dense Merlot, with notes of cola, cabbage leaf, fig and raisiny dark fruit. The palate has richness but it's balanced by lifted acidity, keeping it firmly in a medium-bodied bracket.

title: Zenato 2013 Ripassa  (Valpolicella Superiore Ripasso)
description: Savory and ripe, this has aromas of black currant, underbrush and cooking spice. On the full-bodied palate, white pepper and star anise accent a core of ripe black cherry. Supple tannins lend polish.

title: Zorzal 2015 2KM Malbec-Cabernet Franc (Uco Valley)
description: Floral aromas and asphalt and berry scents introduce this Malbec-Cabernet Franc blend from Juan Pablo Michelini. Its plush and overt palate is a bit shallow, tasting of blackberry and plum and chocolate. The finish is solid but neither long nor powerful. Drink through 2022.

title: Imagery 2016 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This California appellation Pinot is a debut from Imagery. A natural at the dinner table, this shows a firm structure of fine tannins, bright acidity and ripe black cherry and tea flavors that round out the structure. Good concentration meets a medium body as it gets more complex with each sip.

title: 14 Hands 2016 The Reserve Dry Gewürztraminer (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: There's no mistaking the variety in this wine, with its lychee and white flower aromas. The palate is dry and broad in feel, with bitter notes on the finish.

title: Aberrant Cellars 2015 Carpe Noctum Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This is designated as a reserve-level cuvée, and its dark fruit and overall ripeness confirm that ambition. A smoky, earthy component adds depth, and the tannins remain quite astringent. Blood orange and black raspberry flavors stand out at first but fade quickly on the palate. A subtler wine than the previous vintage.

title: Atalayas de Golbán 2014 Torre de Golbán Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: From Dominio de Atauta, this crianza is slightly murky and earthy up front, with aromas of smoky wood, prune and dark grit. A full, saturated palate is packed with power, while this tastes of blackberry, prune and leather.

title: Corte Sant' Alda 2014 Campi Magri  (Valpolicella Superiore Ripasso)
description: Made with organic grapes, this offers aromas of black-skinned berry and baking spice. The medium-bodied, juicy palate doles out black-currant jam, clove and white pepper alongside velvety tannins. Enjoy through 2021.

title: Domaine de la Denante 2016  Saint-Véran
description: Fruity apple aromas also come through strongly in the crisp apple on the palate. This is a tangy, structured wine, bright with acidity and citrus highlights. It comes from the Martin family vineyards and should be ready to drink from late 2018.

title: Cesari 2015 Mara  (Valpolicella Superiore Ripasso)
description: Aromas suggest black-skinned berry, cooking spice and underbrush. The succulent palate delivers black cherry, black pepper and a hint of bitter almond. Enjoy through 2022.

title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2016  Vosne-Romanée
description: The tannins are strong and firm in this wine. Its dense texture and concentration are balanced by crisp red-currant fruit. There is freshness as well from the acidity, giving a crisp aftertaste to this fruity wine. Drink from 2024.

title: Briceland 2014 Alderpoint Vineyard Pinot Noir (Humboldt County)
description: Firm acidity and a sour cherry flavor make this medium-bodied wine very palate-cleansing. It emphasizes liveliness and a light tannic grip over pure fruitiness, but it still delivers complex and attractive cherry and rhubarb flavors.

title: Columbia Crest 2016 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)
description: This wine was fermented in concrete and neutral barrels and aged on lees for 20 months. Its light herb and citrus aromas lead to a medium-bodied palate that's tart, bracing and white grapefruit-like. With acidity like this, it absolutely needs food. Oysters would make an excellent pairing.

title: Contini 2016 Nieddera Rosato (Valle del Tirso)
description: Savory and bright, this enticing rosato opens with aromas of red berry, tangerine and peach. The vibrant, enjoyable palate doles out wild cherry, strawberry and baking spice alongside crisp acidity.

title: Cricova 2013 Codru Dry Cabernet Franc-Merlot (Moldova)
description: A blend of 75% Cabernet Franc and 25% Merlot, this garnet-colored red has aromas of black currant, black plum and black berry. In the mouth, there are flavors of tart cherry pie and black raspberry. The tannins are pleasantly grippy on the midpalate and the finish is smooth.

title: Cristom 2015 Louise Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: This hails from the original block of the estate vineyard—a densely planted plot that delivers slightly leafy rhubarb and raspberry flavors year after year. The wine's green, herbal touches—perhaps the result of 43% whole cluster fermentation—gently fade out on the finish.

title: A to Z 2015 Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: This firm, chewy wine seems to have a spine of steel. It also has ample cherry fruit and some astringent, grippy tannins. Sealed with a screwcap, it will benefit from aggressive decanting or prolonged aeration before drinking.
